content:
🧬 RAD-seq: Variant Calling for Population Genomics

Discover Genetic Variation Across Populations

Restriction site-associated DNA sequencing (RAD-seq) is a reduced-representation sequencing technique that enables cost-effective genome-wide variant discovery. By sequencing DNA fragments adjacent to restriction enzyme cut sites, RAD-seq reveals thousands of genetic markers across the genome - perfect for population studies, phylogenetics, and evolutionary research.

🎯 What is RAD-seq?

RAD-seq uses restriction enzymes to systematically sample the genome, generating comparable markers across many individuals:

  • 💰 Cost-effective: Sequence 0.1-1% of genome instead of whole genome sequencing

  • 🎯 Targeted discovery: Thousands of SNPs across the genome at restriction sites

  • 🌍 Population scale: Genotype hundreds of individuals simultaneously

  • 🔬 No reference needed: Works with reference genomes or de novo approaches

🔧 Pipeline Features

Variant Calling Workflow

  • 📊 Quality Control: FastQC analysis of raw sequencing data

  • ✂️ Trimming: Adapter removal and quality filtering with FastP

  • 🧬 Reference Options:

    • Use existing reference genome (BWA/BWA-mem2 alignment)

    • Generate pseudoreference with CD-HIT-est and Rainbow

  • 🔍 Alignment: BWA or BWA-mem2 mapping with optimized parameters

  • 🎯 UMI Deduplication: Remove PCR duplicates using unique molecular identifiers

  • 📍 Variant Calling: FreeBayes for accurate SNP and indel detection

  • 📈 Reporting: Comprehensive MultiQC quality control reports

🧪 Experimental Applications

Population Genomics

  • 🌍 Population structure: Identify genetic clusters and admixture patterns

  • 🧬 Genetic diversity: Measure heterozygosity, FST, and diversity indices

  • 🔄 Gene flow: Detect migration patterns between populations

Evolutionary Studies

  • 🌳 Phylogenetics: Build phylogenetic trees from thousands of loci

  • ⏱️ Divergence dating: Estimate divergence times between lineages

  • 🎯 Selection scans: Identify regions under positive or balancing selection

Conservation Genetics

  • 🦎 Species delimitation: Identify cryptic species and subspecies

  • 🧬 Inbreeding detection: Assess genetic health of endangered populations

  • 📍 Landscape genetics: Connect genetic patterns with geography

📋 Sample Sheet Format

Your CSV samplesheet defines samples and read files:

sample,fastq_1,fastq_2
population1_ind1,pop1_ind1_R1.fastq.gz,pop1_ind1_R2.fastq.gz
population1_ind2,pop1_ind2_R1.fastq.gz,pop1_ind2_R2.fastq.gz
population2_ind1,pop2_ind1_R1.fastq.gz,pop2_ind1_R2.fastq.gz
population2_ind2,pop2_ind2_R1.fastq.gz,pop2_ind2_R2.fastq.gz

Column Descriptions:

  • sample: Unique sample identifier (individual ID or population_individual)

  • fastq_1: Path to Read 1 FASTQ file

  • fastq_2: Path to Read 2 FASTQ file (leave empty for single-end data)

🧬 Reference Genome Options

Choose the appropriate strategy for your study:

Option 1: With Reference Genome

  • ✅ When to use: Reference genome available for your species

  • 🎯 Benefits: More accurate variant calling, genomic context for SNPs

  • 📍 Output: Variant positions mapped to chromosomes/scaffolds

Option 2: De Novo Pseudoreference

  • ✅ When to use: No reference genome available (non-model organisms)

  • 🔧 Method: Cluster reads to build consensus reference

  • 📍 Output: Relative variant positions across discovered loci

⚙️ UMI-based Deduplication

Unique Molecular Identifiers (UMIs) enable accurate PCR duplicate removal:

  • 🎯 True biological duplicates: Distinguished from PCR artifacts

  • 📊 Improved accuracy: Better allele frequency estimates

  • 🔬 Library complexity: Assess complexity of sequencing libraries

📊 Comprehensive Results

Variant Files

  • 📍 VCF files: Variant Call Format with all discovered SNPs and indels

  • 🧮 Population statistics: Allele frequencies, genotype calls, quality scores

  • 🎯 Filtered variants: High-quality variants passing QC thresholds

Alignment Files

  • 📁 BAM files: Aligned reads for each sample

  • 📊 Coverage statistics: Depth of coverage across loci

  • 🎯 Mapping metrics: Alignment rates, insert sizes, duplicate rates

Quality Control

  • 📈 MultiQC Report: Comprehensive analysis summary with interactive plots

  • 📊 Per-sample QC: Read quality, adapter content, GC bias

  • 🔍 Library metrics: Duplication rates, complexity, coverage uniformity

  • ✅ Variant QC: Transition/transversion ratios, depth distributions

🔬 Biological Applications

Perfect for Research in:

  • 🌍 Ecology: Population structure, local adaptation, gene flow

  • 🐟 Fisheries: Stock identification, management unit delineation

  • 🌿 Plant breeding: Genetic mapping, QTL analysis, marker-assisted selection

  • 🦎 Conservation: Genetic diversity assessment, connectivity studies

  • 🌳 Phylogenomics: Species relationships, hybridization detection

  • 🧬 Evolutionary biology: Selection signatures, demographic history

⚙️ Pipeline Specifications

  • 🔧 Quality Control: FastQC for raw data assessment

  • ✂️ Trimming: FastP for adapter removal and quality filtering

  • 🧬 Alignment: BWA-mem2 (faster) or BWA (standard)

  • 📍 Variant Caller: FreeBayes with population-aware parameters

  • 🎯 Deduplication: UMI-based PCR duplicate removal

  • 📊 Reporting: MultiQC aggregated quality reports

Key Advantages:

  • ✅ Cost-effective genome-wide marker discovery

  • ✅ Scalable to hundreds of individuals

  • ✅ Works with or without reference genome

  • ✅ Proven for non-model organisms

  • ✅ Comprehensive quality control at every step
